review: Few annoying things, when I press enter to go one line before it chs ges the font back to a weird default one. The font can not be fixed by your choice. Also you can type in full screen as the side bar can not be removed. The full screen isn't really a full scream and you can by mistakenly press the side too. Since I am lefty.. it's kind of annoying. The drawing part makes you draw on a separate image and then gets inserted in the notes. Can't draw separately on your typed notes.

I spent 2 hours last night finishing an article, I woke up and check it shows an older version of the note. I have been experiencing a lot of issues and meaning to switch, now am finally going to!! This has happened many a times in the past such an unreliable application!! I would recommend everyone to switch if you want to avoid loosing your valuable work and time. PS: I had been using Evernote for past 10 years

We just released a fix for the slow search times. Please update to 8.9.1 to get that fix. Thanks for your patience!

review: It is one of the worst app to make notes. They don't even let you scan images according to you. The one scanner of their own they provide sometimes scan quickly and sometimes I don't know how much time it takes. Hope the team Carry out the routine check about the app and it's functioning. I can't edit on the images ? If I have to write something in that image and save it I can't do this here. Please look into it and modify the app. Do make it user friendly.

review: Edit 1; the mobile app has horrible experience now. Notes are lost, not saved, not synced and not updated (anything can happen to any note randomly). Disappointed! And I am on the 'Professional' plan Edit 2; it is like falling back for a toxic ex over and over - cancelled my paid subscription for Evernote 3rd time from Professional plan. review: I love Evernote and use it extensively to organize and access all the brain dumps on the million different topics I do. Love the UI/UX, the ability to add sketches, images, move around and edit notes easily, tags, and so on. Only complaint: some occasional glitches can cause me to lose long sections of written content when I'm writing on my phone. It's happening to a lesser extent recently though.

I have been using Evernote since 2013 and literally run my life on this tool. It WAS the best, the most useful app I ever used in my life. But my love for Evernote is slowly dipped in the last few months. The apps have become painfully slow, notes take time to launch and upgrade popups keep ruining the interaction experience. The desktop version (specifically) has become frustrating. Wish the team at Evernote would do something about it to make people like me stay with it.

review: As of today, Evernote just stopped working! Will not open at all. Just the splash screen for a couple of seconds, goes away and then a message box saying it is not responding... Never had a single issue before.. Sent a crash report. Tried all the usual fixes (force close, restart phone, reinstall) with no luck. Hundreds of my notes and writings in there! Very upset.

review: I have been using and loving Evernote for several years now. Recently however, I am having problems with notes I've entered on my phone app and then wanting to view on my tablet. It's now becoming almost unusable and a waist of time to enter on one device and then to see the note on another device. I don't think they are syncing correctly. I'm starting to hate this program.

UPDATE: Thankfully, the jumping cursor problem has been resolved, so I am able to use Evernote for many of my tasks again. Recently, I have noticed that there are usually several versions of a note that keep showing up. I used to love Evernote. After a recent update, I cannot edit my notes without the cursor constantly jumping to the end of the next word. This is so frustrating! Please fix this! I am running Android on a Moto G Power phone, and everything else on the phone is working great.

I've used this app for years and up until recently, I loved it. Now there's issues where it duplicates notes multiple times after you close out the app. Or when you open the app, you are unable to access your note and there is a cycling feature showing that the app is trying to open. Or it opens, and you cannot edit anything as it says that it's trying to update itself. This has only started happening within the last month and a half, and it is extremely frustrating for an app that used to work.

I never uninstalled the app because I wanted to keep all my notes I made over the years. The free version is pretty basic, but meets my needs for keeping track of all the books I read. I wasn't really happy with the app I had switched to.

review: Very disapointed with this app. It looks okay, but functionality has basically regressed. Used to be way better 5+ years ago. Messed up the workflow for me. The widgets used to be better. Only two basic ones now, and there is now no way to sort by last viewed. Forces me to search over and over again. Search bar doesn't even have a shortcut to the last searched. Good for you that you made it impossible to export to OneNote, otherwise I would have switched long ago.

What has happened? It seems this latest version has lost all connection with my data. Get this fixed ASAP!Existing notes don't load, List of notebooks change each time I enter the app, notes from the phone don't sync elsewhere. Tried to refresh the app, it just got worse. If I can't rely on my phone app now makes this app less productive. Long time user over 10 years.

review: What the hell. I uninstalled this app back in 2021 because the interface became absolutely horrible to use and navigate, then I try coming back to it almost 2 years later to see if anything was fixed, but it's worse? It's so buggy, you can barely open your keyboard without everything freezing. Hell, anything makes the app freeze, and I'm pretty sure it's not my phone because all my other apps run smoothly. Also, they took off the gifs on notes or something? You ruined a perfect app, how sad.

Longtime user of Evernote (since 2009!), desktop & mobile, really frustrated. This app is unusable. Editing or creating new notes can't be saved, app has to be force closed to get out of it. Sad. Evernote was an amazing program the first few years, but has been dreadful the last several years with glitches & crashes as well as them removing ability to easily export all my notes. Moving to something else.

review: Used it back in the days when it was fully free (at least Im pretty convinced it was). Now I discovered the paid version, still sticking to the free one because it takes care of most of my needs. The paid version seems relatively expensive, though might totally be worth it for some. Great app, lots of functionality, good looking and clear GUI and Im planning to use it to replace the samsung notes app on my phone.

Cannot edit notes, have to restart the app to enter edit mode. There was an article called Evernote, the bug-riddlen elephant, and that was back in 2014. Seven years later, still the same. A brand new version work lots of useless new features, removed some of the useful old ones, and full of bugs that are going to take months, of not years to get resolved, thanks to paying customers. Mobile app extremely unstable, have to restart multiple times to edit notes. Edit nov 2022: keeps crashing.

I used to LOVE this app as I am a big list maker. However the most recent updates have been majorly glitchy. Changes aren't being saved and now I can't even access my notes at all and I have important things in my phone that I don't have saved anywhere else. It is frustrating to the point that I'll be switching to something else. I won't even go into how many times it asks you to buy premium, then tells you that you'll lose the offer. If only! I've declined a hundred times.

review: I use Evernote extensively for scanning large piles of receipts and find the scanner app very buggy requiring me to rescan the same receipt multiple times. It intermittently works which makes no sense. Changing the format to Document BW works about 2/3 times, the other times it messes up the image. I have a relatively popular and powerful phone, the Samsung S20 FE. Evernote, please test your product!! Do not ask user to do testing for you, unless you are going to compensate them.

I love Evernote because I can access/edit it on both my phone & laptop. It's handy to be able to view when you are off-line. One thing that I do NOT see as an improvement is that it doesn't ask you if you want to save changes before you exit. A feature that I would appreciate is that if there is a note conflict, if it would highlight what the differences were between the two. In other words, highlight what is in one version as opposed to the other as there can be deletions & additions. Thanks!

review: For over a decade Evernote's been one of the most seamless & useful apps ever made for smartphones. I'm getting to the point that I'm wondering if I need to find a better replacement & start moving things over. I've got a decade worth of my life in this app so obviously that's the last thing I want to do. But idk what else to do.

review: A very convenient app for note-taking. It's useful too that your notes are stored in the cloud, so you can access them from any device. I don't know why this is happening, I've never intentionally duplicated a note.

review: I've been a user since 2013. If you want to scale up your organization, you need more than just a to do list app. Evernote is one way to go. I recently switched to a new phone and Evernote app from v8 to v10. It was a jarring change at first, but the new version helps save me time through the configurable home screen: I can show a list of notes with reminders due today right there. I seem to be able to more quickly and easily search to find what I need now too.
